comments:
Build ID: HEAD as of 4/27/2007

A user who adds an external tool builder on the BuilderPropertyPage, changes his/her mind, and impatiently tries to remove it twice while it is still running gets a "Widget is disposed" exception.

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Start Eclipse on a new workspace.
2. Create a new project "foo".
3. Right-click "foo" -> Properties.  Select the Builders page.
4. Create an external tool builder with the command "/bin/sleep 30" (or equivalent on non-Unix).
5. Press OK to save the properties; the new builder starts running.
6. Once again, right-click "foo" -> Properties.  Select the Builders page.
7. Select the external tool builder, press Remove, and press OK.  The OK button becomes disabled but the dialog doesn't close.
8. Wait a few seconds.  The Cancel button becomes focused.
9. Switch to another property page (e.g., Resource); the OK button becomes enabled again.  Then switch back to Builders.
10. Click OK.  A "User Operation is Waiting" dialog appears showing "Setting project description." (i.e., removal of the builder) waiting on "Building workspace".
11. When the builder finishes, the exception is written to the log.

Exception:

Unhandled event loop exception during blocked modal context.

This bug might be similar to bug 87787.

This sounds very similar to the symptom described in bug 64937 comment 14.  It was not clear to me from that bug what the recommended way is for a PreferencePage performOk() implementation to perform a change that might block, but whatever that way is, BuilderPropertyPage#performOk() needs to use it.

In the process of debugging this, I discovered that updateJob.runInUIThread in ProgressManager#scheduleProgressMonitorJob activates the UI regardless of whether the progress dialog was opened, which looks wrong to me: it could leave the UI active without a modal progress dialog on top, allowing the user to do something nasty (as in this bug).  An alternative way to fix the bug is to move the setUserInterfaceActive(true) inside the if.  When I tried the steps to reproduce with this modification, controls in the properties dialog ignored my clicks after step 7, and thus I could not trigger the bug.
